items.title: All NASA News - NASA
items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: NASA News
items.content_text: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

items.title: NASA Awards Help Inspire Future Innovators Through STEM Engagement - NASA
items.content_text: NASA has awarded more than $5 million to 29 institutions nationwide to expand and strengthen science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) learning beyond

items.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Expedition 74 Preps CubeSats and Photographs Earth for Research - NASA
items.content_text: Expedition 74 focused on installing CubeSats and observing Earth aboard the International Space Station on Thursday. The trio from NASA and Roscosmos kept up ongoing research operations along with standard orbital lab maintenance throughout the day.

items.title: Advanced Tech Research on Station as Crew-12 Announces Launch Opportunities - NASA
items.content_text: Robotics and artificial intelligence were back on the research schedule Wednesday for the Expedition 74 crew to inspire college students and explore boosting crew efficiency. Earth observations and life support maintenance also rounded out the day for the orbital residents aboard the International Space Station.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Radar Mission Peers Through Clouds to See Mississippi River Delta
items.content_text: A new image from the NISAR mission shows off the satellite’s ability to reveal details of Earth’s surfaces. The science team also released new sample data.

items.title: NASA Analysis Shows La Niña Limited Sea Level Rise in 2025
items.content_text: A mild La Niña caused greater rainfall over the Amazon basin, which offset rising sea levels due to record warming of Earth’s oceans.

items.title: Networks Keeping NASA’s Artemis II Mission Connected
items.content_text: Artemis missions rely on both the Near Space Network, managed by NASA Goddard, and the Deep Space Network, managed by the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

items.title: NASA’s Juno Measures Thickness of Europa’s Ice Shell
items.content_text: Results from the solar-powered spacecraft provide a new measurement of the thickness of the ice shell encasing the Jovian moon’s ocean.

items.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
items.content_text: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

items.title: NASA Reveals New Details About Dark Matter’s Influence on Universe
items.content_text: With the Webb telescope’s unprecedented sensitivity, scientists are learning more about dark matter’s influence on stars, galaxies, and even planets like Earth.

items.title: NASA’s SunRISE SmallSats Ace Tests, Moving Closer to Launch
items.content_text: The small satellites passed a crucible of tests, ending with a simulation of the intense vibrations of launch.

items.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
items.content_text: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.content_text: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, the leading center for robotic exploration of the solar system.

items.title: December 2025 Company Update

items.title: November 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations.   Design  As the program continues to mature, we are releasing larger groups of parts through our design sprints. In November, we released 1,602 parts, unlocking downstream manufacturin

items.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
items.content_text: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

items.title: October 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch.
